column4: How do you set the screen resolution to one setting (say 800x600) and the desktop resolution to a higher setting (say 1280x1024)?  I've seen this before where moving the mouse to the edge of the screen rolls you around the larger desktop.  Can't find this in ubuntu though.
I want to simulate a fixed "zoom" without using compiz.  In order to get around adobe flash bugs in linux, but to watch hulu video's.
No idea's on setting the screen resolution to one thing and gnomes desktop resolution to another setting?
in xorg there's a config called virtual desktop
